items.title: 'We have so much to thank Terry for'  - Bellamy
items.summary: Wales head coach Craig Bellamy describes Terry Yorath's impact on Welsh football as "immeasurable" as tributes are paid to the late ex-Wales boss.

items.title: Winning in England will be Australia's next goal - McGrath column
items.summary: After a comfortable 4-1 series win in the Ashes, Australia's next goal will be winning in England for the first time in 26 years when they tour next summer, says Glenn McGrath.

items.title: Arsenal manager Slegers signs new three-year deal
items.summary: Arsenal head coach Renee Slegers signs a new three-year deal with the Women's Super League club.

The news comes just a day after the company introduced the OnePlus Turbo 6 and Turbo 6V in China. According to tipster Digital Chat Station, a high-end performance phone with a MediaTek Dimensity 9500â€¦

items.title: Sabalenka beats Keys to reach Brisbane semi-final
items.summary: World number one Aryna Sabalenka continues her Australian Open preparations by beating Madison Keys to reach the Brisbane semi-finals.

items.title: Why Man City have signed 'extraordinary' Semenyo
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo has gone from Bristol City to Man City in the space of three years. BBC Sport looks at why Pep Guardiola has moved for the Bournemouth man.

items.title: 'If you're outside the top six, you can never target an FA Cup run'
items.summary: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis explains why the FA Cup has fallen down the pecking order for managers, despite still being a special competition.

items.title: Ebnoutalib's rapid rise from fourth tier to potential star
items.summary: Younes Ebnoutalib was playing in Germany's fourth tier a year ago - now he hopes to be the latest in a line of star forwards at Eintracht Frankfurt.

items.title: Macclesfield's 'massive occasion' tinged with sadness

items.title: Brosnan, Prince Naseem and the embrace that never happened
items.summary: When Prince Naseem Hamed met actor Pierce Brosnan in the lead-up to a new film, it brought back thoughts of a reconciliation with trainer Brendan Ingle that never happened.

items.title: 'Relaxed' Hearts keep calm amid Old Firm noise
items.summary: After a tumultuous week at Celtic and continued transfer talk at the champions and rivals Rangers, Scottish Premiership leaders Hearts appear well prepared for the second half of the season.

items.title: Weekly sports quiz:  How many managers have Man Utd had since Ferguson?
items.summary: How much attention have you paid to what's happened in the world of sport over the past seven days?

items.title: Unloved in PE, ignored at top - what is cross country's future?
items.summary: Cross country evokes miserable school memories for many, while top athletes focus on Olympic disciplines instead - what is its future?

items.title: The NFL record-breaker who never planned to play the sport
items.summary: Jacksonville Jaguars kicker Cam Little holds the record for the NFL's longest field goal - not bad for someone who never planned to play the sport.

items.title: McCullum keen to remain as England head coach despite Ashes defeat
items.summary: Brendan McCullum says he's "not opposed" to making adjustments but says a complete overhaul of his approach won't be in store should he remain England coach, following their 4-1 Ashes series defeat to Australia down under.

items.title: 'We need to be smarter' - Stokes admits England must improve
items.summary: Ben Stokes says it's time for "some honest truths" to be shared amongst his team, following England's 4-1 Ashes series defeat in Australia.

items.title: England show fight but fall short as Australia seal 4-1 Ashes win
items.summary: After bowling England out for 342, Australia chase down their winning target of 160 with five wickets in hand to win the fifth Ashes Test on the final day in Sydney, sealing a 4-1 series win to retain the urn.

items.title: 'Whoever signed off England's tour has to go' - Agnew column
items.summary: England's 4-1 Ashes defeat is the most disappointing I have covered and whoever signed off on the tourists' preparation has to go, writes Jonathan Agnew.

items.title: Carey hits four to seal five-wicket win for Australia
items.summary: Alex Carey secures victory in style for Australia, as he hits a four to seal a five-wicket win against England on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney, as Australia win the series 4-1.

items.title: 'He's a yard short!' - Labuschagne run out as England show late fight
items.summary: Marnus Labuschagne is run out for 37 after some excellent fielding from Matthew Potts as Australia fall to 121-5, chasing 160 to win on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: England futures at risk - Ashes player ratings
items.summary: Find out who got a 10 and who is facing an uncertain international future with our Ashes player ratings.

items.title: 'That has spun a mile' - Smith stunned by brilliant Jacks delivery
items.summary: Australia captain Steve Smith is left stunned as he's bowled by a brilliant delivery from Will Jacks for 12, leaving Australia on 92-3, needing 68 runs to win the fifth and final Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: 'It's had a shocker' - Snicko controversy strikes England again
items.summary: England find themselves on the wrong side of another controversial Snicko decision after Jake Weatherald is given not out despite there appearing to be a murmur on the Snicko technology, as the ball passes the bat - with Weatherald on 16 and Australia 33-0, chasing 160 to win the fifth and final Asâ€¦

items.title: AMD is unfazed by Panther Lake's big integrated GPU â€” 'It's not even a fair fight' to compare the Arc B390 to Strix Halo, AMD exec claims
items.summary: AMD's Rahul Tikoo claims that the company has a better selection of products compared to Panther Lake that are better suited to the needs of graphics-intensive customers and mainstream consumers.

items.title: Rumoured Solskjaer return to Man Utd 'seems ridiculous'
items.summary: Match of the Day pundits Danny Murphy and Stephen Warnock look at who should take charge at Manchester United following Ruben Amorim's departure earlier this week.

items.title: 'A wonderful innings' - Bethell's brilliant knock ended by Starc
items.summary: Jacob Bethell's memorable innings comes to an end as he's caught for 154 by Alex Carey, off the bowling of Mitchell Starc to leave England 328-9, with a lead of 146 on day five of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: Wilson will have his 'pick of clubs' - MOTD's Murphy
items.summary: Match of the Day's Danny Murphy analyses Fulham's Harry Wilson's current form and "intelligent" winning performance against Chelsea.

items.title: Newcastle score twice in stoppage time to win seven-goal thriller
items.summary: Harvey Barnes scores twice as Newcastle come from behind to beat Leeds in a dramatic seven-goal thriller at St James' Park.

items.title: Thiago scores twice as Brentford beat Sunderland
items.summary: Igor Thiago scores twice to continue his excellent recent form as Brentford sweep Sunderland aside at the Gtech Community Stadium.

items.title: Sesko scores twice but Burnley fight back to hold Man Utd
items.summary: Manchester United are denied victory in their first game since the sacking of head coach Ruben Amorim as relegation-threatened Burnley fight back to claim only their third point in 12 games.

items.title: Semenyo strikes late as Bournemouth edge out Spurs
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo scores a stunning late winner in what is likely his final game for Bournemouth as they beat Tottenham in dramatic fashion at Vitality Stadium.

items.title: Wilson goal helps Fulham beat 10-man Chelsea
items.summary: New Chelsea head coach Liam Rosenior watched from the stands as Harry Wilson's fine finish condemns his team to defeat by west London rivals Fulham at Craven Cottage.

items.title: Man City draw with Brighton as title bid continues to falter

items.title: Keane's actions not deliberate - Moyes on red card

items.title: Defensively, we are more stable than ever - Guardiola
items.summary: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola is pleased with his side's defensive performance highlighting Max Alleyne as "exceptional" in their 1-1 draw at home to Brighton.

items.title: Senior AMD executive suggests consumers buy cheap CPUs to combat memory pricing squeeze â€” says â€˜consumers have a wide assortment of choice available for all kinds of price pointsâ€™
items.summary: An AMD executive says that they're not too concerned about the memory shortage, points out that AMD has a wide range of CPUs available "for all kinds of price points."

items.summary: Panther Lakeâ€™s 12 Xe3 cores can deliver some serious gaming horsepower, but the software still needs work

items.summary: Beijing doesn't want tech companies stockpiling H200 chips while it's still figuring out how to balance the needs of its AI industry and its push for homegrown semiconductors.

items.title: Nvidia's next-gen RTX 60 series might not debut until the second half of 2027, says leaker â€” rumor claims Rubin architecture will power future consumer GPUs

items.summary: Asus launches new ROG Strix LC IV series of AIO liquid coolers that don't need any cables, thanks to a proprietary AIO Q-Connector.

items.summary: Dell has this week unveiled a massive 52-inch 6K monitor, the first curved ultrawide of that size and resolution.

items.summary: Elon Musk says that modern cleanrooms are built wrong, and if Tesla builds its own fab, he will be able to eat and smoke in that facility.

The Legion Pro Rollable is a gaming laptop that can go from wide to ultrawide, while the Rollable XD's extra screen height becomes a dynamic lid display when the front display isn't extended.
